properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long duration heat event is expected. Daytime high temperatures in the low to mid thirties with overnight lows near 20 are expected until the end of this week. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T07:13:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T15:14:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1581532505.2020
Area: Sachigo Lake - Bearskin Lake, Big Trout Lake - Kasabonika, Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake, Webequie, Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Ontario Amber Alert In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ontario AMBER Alert in effect. NIAGARA REGIONAL Police Service have requested an AMBER Alert. The victim, Dushaun Mitchell, is Male, 6 yr old, 3 feet 0 inches, 60lbs, Black eyes, Short hair. Suspect, John Mitchell, is Male, 44 year old, 5 feet 7 inches, brown eyes, Short hair. Vehicle is Gold Mercedes, license Plate unknown. Vehicle was last seen traveling from 212-37 Mericourt Drive, Hamilton Ontario.  https://amberalert.opp.ca If observed call 9 1 1
Expires: 2020-06-29T11:40:53-04:00
Originated from CAP Alert: OPP Provincial Operations Centre, 2020-06-28T12:40:53-04:00, opp6e678d54-5ab9-ea11-80f9-005056971de5
Area: Ontario
properties.Author: OPP Provincial Operations Centre

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:25 P.M. NDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Maximum rainfall rates: locally 25 mm per hour or more in thunderstorms. Maximum wind gusts: near 90 km/h in thunderstorms. Locations: Buchens and the Interior. Time span: continuing until early this evening. Remarks: A line of severe thunderstorms west of Red Indian Lake is moving northeastward at 20 km/h. Torrential downpours, strong wind gusts and frequent lightning are expected to accompany these storms. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-28T21:58:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T19:00:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2956001260.2020
Area: Buchans and the interior
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: One day heat event for today. As a warm from pushes through this afternoon, daytime maximum temperatures near 32 degrees Celsius are expected with humidex values near 40. Relief from the heat is expected tonight as a much cooler airmass moves into the area. These conditions pose a health risk when you are not used to the heat. Everyone is at risk from heat, especially older adults; infants and young children; and people with chronic illnesses. You are advised to 1) drink plenty of cool liquids before feeling thirsty; and 2) keep cool by dressing for the weather and spending a few hours each day in a cool place. Hot and humid air can bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T07:16:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T15:17:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2891381245.2020
Area: Fort Severn
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:43 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-28T21:17:50-00:00

properties.Title: Flood Watch Is Being Issued For Southwestern, Western And Central Regions In Manitoba.
properties.Summary:
Description: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure’s Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Watch for southwestern, western and central regions of Manitoba. A weather system may release 75 to 100 millimetres of rain in these areas in between June 28 to July 1. Areas in southwest Manitoba, including Virden and Brandon could see up to 175 millimetres of rain during this time. If you are in the affected area, be watchful as local waterways are expected to rise quickly and may cause flooding. There is a potential for overland flooding in low lying areas. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Use caution when driving on all roads as road conditions may have changed. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by local authorities, listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Stay tuned to local media for updates.
Expires: 2020-07-02T16:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-06-28T14:34:38-05:00, 0CE6CD87-E603-6E9E-5307-A92E15FA11E0
Area: Southwestern, Western and Central Manitoba
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A stationary front is triggering scattered thunderstorms over southeastern Saskatchewan and western Manitoba this morning. Some of these thunderstorms may reach severe limits. Thunderstorms are expected to redevelop across much of the watch area this afternoon and will persist well into the night. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded eastwards this afternoon as the event unfolds. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T08:04:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T17:15:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3696357167.2020

properties.Summary:

Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and torrential rain. Potential rainfall rates: 25 mm per hour or higher in thunderstorms. Potential wind gusts: 90 km/h or more in thunderstorms. Locations: Corner Brook and Gros Morne east to Terra Nova. Time span: late this afternoon and early this evening. Remarks: Scattered thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon. There is a greater risk for severe thunderstorms over the interior areas. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-06-29T01:59:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T18:34:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2511705872.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:13 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to golf ball size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is near Oakburn and is moving northeast at 40 km/h. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-28T21:27:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T19:14:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1505507767.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:14 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. These thunderstorms stretch from Dauphin northeast to Meadow Portage and are moving northeast at 40 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
